verses.text: And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* spake unto Moses , saying ,
Speak unto all the congregation of the children of Israel , and say unto them, Ye shall be holy : for I the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* your God \add am\add* holy. \p
¶ Ye shall fear every man his mother , and his father , and keep my sabbaths : I \add am\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* your God. \p
¶ Turn ye not unto idols , nor make to yourselves molten gods : I \add am\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* your God. \p
¶ And if ye offer a sacrifice of peace offerings unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, ye shall offer it at your own will.
It shall be eaten the same day ye offer it, and on the morrow : and if ought remain until the third day , it shall be burnt in the fire.
And if it be eaten at all on the third day , it \add is\add* abominable ; it shall not be accepted.

Therefore \add every one\add* that eateth it shall bear his iniquity , because he hath profaned the hallowed thing of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: and that soul shall be cut off from among his people. \p
¶ And when ye reap the harvest of your land , thou shalt not wholly reap the corners of thy field , neither shalt thou gather the gleanings of thy harvest.

And thou shalt not glean thy vineyard , neither shalt thou gather \add every\add* grape of thy vineyard ; thou shalt leave them for the poor and stranger : I \add am\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* your God. \p
¶ Ye shall not steal , neither deal falsely , neither lie one to another. \p
¶ And ye shall not swear by my name falsely , neither shalt thou profane the name of thy God : I \add am\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*. \p
¶ Thou shalt not defraud thy neighbour , neither rob \add him:\add* the wages of him that is hired shall not abide with thee all night until the morning. \p
¶ Thou shalt not curse the deaf , nor put a stumblingblock before the blind , but shalt fear thy God : I \add am\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*. \p
¶ Ye shall do no unrighteousness in judgment : thou shalt not respect the person of the poor , nor honour the person of the mighty : \add but\add* in righteousness shalt thou judge thy neighbour. \p
¶ Thou shalt not go up and down \add as\add* a talebearer among thy people : neither shalt thou stand against the blood of thy neighbour : I \add am\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*. \p
¶ Thou shalt not hate thy brother in thine heart : thou shalt in any wise rebuke thy neighbour , and not suffer sin upon him.\f + \fr 19.17 \ft and…: or, that thou bear not sin for him\f* \p
¶ Thou shalt not avenge , nor bear any grudge against the children of thy people , but thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself : I \add am\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*. \p

¶ Ye shall keep my statutes. Thou shalt not let thy cattle gender with a diverse kind : thou shalt not sow thy field with mingled seed : neither shall a garment mingled of linen and woollen come upon thee. \p

¶ And whosoever lieth carnally with a woman , that \add is\add* a bondmaid , betrothed to an husband , and not at all redeemed , nor freedom given her; she shall be scourged ; they shall not be put to death , because she was not free.\f + \fr 19.20 \ft betrothed…: or, abused by any: Heb. reproached by (or, for) man\f*\f + \fr 19.20 \ft she shall…: or, they, etc: Heb. there shall be a scourging\f*
And he shall bring his trespass offering unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation , \add even\add* a ram for a trespass offering.

And the priest shall make an atonement for him with the ram of the trespass offering before the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* for his sin which he hath done : and the sin which he hath done shall be forgiven him. \p

¶ And when ye shall come into the land , and shall have planted all manner of trees for food , then ye shall count the fruit thereof as uncircumcised : three years shall it be as uncircumcised unto you: it shall not be eaten of.

But in the fourth year all the fruit thereof shall be holy to praise the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \add withal\add*.\f + \fr 19.24 \ft holy…: Heb. holiness of praises to the \+nd LORD\+nd*\f*
And in the fifth year shall ye eat of the fruit thereof, that it may yield unto you the increase thereof: I \add am\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* your God. \p
¶ Ye shall not eat \add any thing\add* with the blood : neither shall ye use enchantment , nor observe times.
Ye shall not round the corners of your heads , neither shalt thou mar the corners of thy beard.
Ye shall not make any cuttings in your flesh for the dead , nor print any marks upon you: I \add am\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*. \p
¶ Do not prostitute thy daughter , to cause her to be a whore ; lest the land fall to whoredom , and the land become full of wickedness.\f + \fr 19.29 \ft prostitute: Heb. profane\f* \p
¶ Ye shall keep my sabbaths , and reverence my sanctuary : I \add am\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*. \p
¶ Regard not them that have familiar spirits , neither seek after wizards , to be defiled by them: I \add am\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* your God. \p
¶ Thou shalt rise up before the hoary head , and honour the face of the old man , and fear thy God : I \add am\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*. \p
¶ And if a stranger sojourn with thee in your land , ye shall not vex him.\f + \fr 19.33 \ft vex: or, oppress\f*

\add But\add* the stranger that dwelleth with you shall be unto you as one born among you, and thou shalt love him as thyself; for ye were strangers in the land of Egypt : I \add am\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* your God. \p
¶ Ye shall do no unrighteousness in judgment , in meteyard , in weight , or in measure.

Just balances , just weights , a just ephah , and a just hin , shall ye have: I \add am\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* your God , which brought you out of the land of Egypt.\f + \fr 19.36 \ft weights: Heb. stones\f*
Therefore shall ye observe all my statutes , and all my judgments , and do them: I \add am\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
